snippet: In financial straits, Alfred, N.Y., asked Alfred University and Alfred State College to pay more for water. When one institution balked, the village gave an ultimatum: Pay up or go thirsty.
abstract: Village of Alfred, NY, home to private Alfred University and Alfred State College, part of State University of New York, needed to cover costs of cleaning up after students and told schools they had to pay more for their water; schools, as nonprofit, tax-exempt entities, are not legally required to pay anything for public services and SUNY balked; village gave ultimatum: pay up or go thirsty; such Pilot payments, acronym for payments in lieu of taxes, are increasingly common and often contentious.
lead_paragraph: In financial straits, Alfred, N.Y., asked Alfred University and Alfred State College to pay more for water. When one institution balked, the village gave an ultimatum: Pay up or go thirsty.

headline.main: A Town-Gown Clash Over the Costs of Public Services
headline.print_headline: Shared Names, and a Town-Gown Clash Over Costs
